description: The StorageController schema describes a storage controller and its properties.  A storage controller represents a physical or virtual storage device that produces volumes.

AssetTag.description: The user-assigned asset tag for this storage controller.
AssetTag.longDescription: This property shall track the storage controller for inventory purposes.

CacheSummary.description: The cache memory of the storage controller in general detail.
CacheSummary.longDescription: This property shall contain properties that describe the cache memory for this resource.

PersistentCacheSizeMiB.description: The portion of the cache memory that is persistent, measured in MiB.
PersistentCacheSizeMiB.longDescription: This property shall contain the amount of cache memory that is persistent as measured in mebibytes.  This size shall be less than or equal to the TotalCacheSizeMiB.

TotalCacheSizeMiB.description: The total configured cache memory, measured in MiB.
TotalCacheSizeMiB.longDescription: This property shall contain the amount of configured cache memory as measured in mebibytes.

ControllerRates.description: This property describes the various controller rates used for processes such as volume rebuild or consistency checks.
ControllerRates.longDescription: This object shall contain all the rate settings available on the controller.

ConsistencyCheckRatePercent.description: The percentage of controller resources used for performing a data consistency check on volumes.
ConsistencyCheckRatePercent.longDescription: This property shall contain the percentage of controller resources used for checking data consistency on volumes.

RebuildRatePercent.description: The percentage of controller resources used for rebuilding/repairing volumes.
RebuildRatePercent.longDescription: This property shall contain the percentage of controller resources used for rebuilding volumes.

TransformationRatePercent.description: The percentage of controller resources used for transforming volumes from one configuration to another.
TransformationRatePercent.longDescription: This property shall contain the percentage of controller resources used for transforming volumes.

FirmwareVersion.description: The firmware version of this storage controller.
FirmwareVersion.longDescription: This property shall contain the firmware version as defined by the manufacturer for the associated storage controller.

Identifiers.description: The durable names for the storage controller.
Identifiers.longDescription: This property shall contain a list of all known durable names for the associated storage controller.

Location.description: The location of the storage controller.
Location.longDescription: This property shall contain location information of the associated storage controller.

Manufacturer.description: The manufacturer of this storage controller.
Manufacturer.longDescription: This property shall contain the name of the organization responsible for producing the storage controller.  This organization may be the entity from which the storage controller is purchased, but this is not necessarily true.

Model.description: The model number for the storage controller.
Model.longDescription: This property shall contain the name by which the manufacturer generally refers to the storage controller.

PCIeInterface.description: The PCIe interface details for this controller.

LanesInUse.description: This is the number of PCIe lanes in use by this device.

MaxLanes.description: This is the number of PCIe lanes supported by this device.

MaxPCIeType.description: The highest version of the PCIe specification supported by this device.

PCIeType.description: The version of the PCIe specification in use by this device.

PartNumber.description: The part number for this storage controller.
PartNumber.longDescription: This property shall contain a part number assigned by the organization that is responsible for producing or manufacturing the storage controller.

Ports.description: The link to the collection of ports that exist on the storage controller.
Ports.longDescription: This property shall contain a link to a resource collection of type PortCollection.

SKU.description: The SKU for this storage controller.
SKU.longDescription: This property shall contain the stock-keeping unit number for this storage storage controller.

SerialNumber.description: The serial number for this storage controller.
SerialNumber.longDescription: This property shall contain a manufacturer-allocated number that identifies the storage controller.

SpeedGbps.description: The maximum speed of the storage controller's device interface.
SpeedGbps.longDescription: This property shall represent the maximum supported speed of the storage bus interface, in Gbit/s.  The specified interface connects the controller to the storage devices, not the controller to a host.  For example, SAS bus not PCIe host bus.

SupportedControllerProtocols.description: The supported set of protocols for communicating to this storage controller.
SupportedControllerProtocols.longDescription: This property shall contain the supported set of protocols for communicating to this storage controller.

SupportedDeviceProtocols.description: The protocols that the storage controller can use to communicate with attached devices.
SupportedDeviceProtocols.longDescription: This property shall contain the set of protocols this storage controller can use to communicate with attached devices.

SupportedRAIDTypes.description: The set of RAID types supported by the storage controller.

enumDescriptions.None: A placement policy with no redundancy at the device level.
enumDescriptions.RAID0: A placement policy where consecutive logical blocks of data are uniformly distributed across a set of independent storage devices without offering any form of redundancy.
enumDescriptions.RAID00: A placement policy that creates a RAID 0 stripe set over two or more RAID 0 sets.
enumDescriptions.RAID01: A data placement policy that creates a mirrored device (RAID 1) over a set of striped devices (RAID 0).
enumDescriptions.RAID1: A placement policy where each logical block of data is stored on more than one independent storage device.
enumDescriptions.RAID10: A placement policy that creates a striped device (RAID 0) over a set of mirrored devices (RAID 1).
enumDescriptions.RAID10E: A placement policy that uses a RAID 0 stripe set over two or more RAID 10 sets.
enumDescriptions.RAID10Triple: A placement policy that uses a striped device (RAID 0) over a set of triple mirrored devices (RAID 1Triple).
enumDescriptions.RAID1E: A placement policy that uses a form of mirroring implemented over a set of independent storage devices where logical blocks are duplicated on a pair of independent storage devices so that data is uniformly distributed across the storage devices.
enumDescriptions.RAID1Triple: A placement policy where each logical block of data is mirrored three times across a set of three independent storage devices.
enumDescriptions.RAID3: A placement policy using parity-based protection where logical bytes of data are uniformly distributed across a set of independent storage devices and where the parity is stored on a dedicated independent storage device.
enumDescriptions.RAID4: A placement policy using parity-based protection where logical blocks of data are uniformly distributed across a set of independent storage devices and where the parity is stored on a dedicated independent storage device.
enumDescriptions.RAID5: A placement policy using parity-based protection for storing stripes of 'n' logical blocks of data and one logical block of parity across a set of 'n+1' independent storage devices where the parity and data blocks are interleaved across the storage devices.
enumDescriptions.RAID50: A placement policy that uses a RAID 0 stripe set over two or more RAID 5 sets of independent storage devices.
enumDescriptions.RAID6: A placement policy using parity-based protection for storing stripes of 'n' logical blocks of data and two logical blocks of independent parity across a set of 'n+2' independent storage devices where the parity and data blocks are interleaved across the storage devices.
enumDescriptions.RAID60: A placement policy that uses a RAID 0 stripe set over two or more RAID 6 sets of independent storage devices.
enumDescriptions.RAID6TP: A placement policy that uses parity-based protection for storing stripes of 'n' logical blocks of data and three logical blocks of independent parity across a set of 'n+3' independent storage devices where the parity and data blocks are interleaved across the storage devices.

SupportedRAIDTypes.longDescription: This property shall contain an array of all the RAID types supported by this controller.

title: #StorageController.v1_0_0.StorageController
